faq.title: Safari Questions?
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know before booking your adventure

q1.question: Do I need prior horse riding experience?
q1.answer: No! We cater to all skill levels. Our guides will match you with a suitable horse and provide basic instruction before the safari. Beginners are always welcome.

q2.question: What's the minimum age for safari?
q2.answer: The minimum age is 8 years old for our regular safari. Children must be accompanied by an adult. We also offer special family safaris for younger children (ages 6-7) with parent-led horses.

q3.question: How long does the safari last?
q3.answer: Our standard safari is 2-3 hours including breaks. We also offer half-day (4-5 hours) and full-day (6-8 hours) safaris with lunch included for more experienced riders.

q4.question: What should I wear?
q4.answer: Wear comfortable long pants (jeans or riding pants), closed-toe shoes with a small heel (boots are best), and layers for changing weather. We provide helmets and safety equipment.

q5.question: Is it safe? What about insurance?
q5.answer: Safety is our top priority. All riders wear helmets, guides are certified, and horses are well-trained. We carry liability insurance, but recommend riders have personal travel/accident insurance.

q6.question: Can I bring my camera?
q6.answer: Absolutely! The views are stunning. We recommend secure bags or backpacks. Our guides can also take photos at scenic stops. GoPros and action cameras are welcome.

q7.question: What's included in the price?
q7.answer: Price includes: horse rental, helmet, guide service, bottled water, and scenic route access. Longer safaris include snacks/lunch. Transportation to the starting point is not included.

q8.question: Do you offer group discounts?
q8.answer: Yes! Groups of 5+ people receive 10% off, and groups of 10+ receive 15% off. Perfect for corporate outings, family reunions, or friend groups. Contact us for custom packages.
